page.title: 03Titchfield Abbey
page.content: The abbey in Titchfield was founded in 1232 by Peter des Roches,Bishop of Winchester.The abbey originally had thirty rooms and fourteen Premonstatensian monks living in them.The abbey's land used to take up most of Hampshire and the land used to join on to other abbey's lands in the area.The abbey is owned at the moment by English Heritage,and has had four curators before Mr.Evans, the current curator.The abbey gets most visitors on nice days and on bank holidays.It was dismantled by the Lord of Southampton and made into a Tudor mansion.There are eleven bodies buried between the two wells. One is Abbot Issac and another abbot Richard.The abbey cost Â£32 pounds to be built and was built by the monks that lived there.
